trans-unit.source: Please answer the following questions about the community in which you live.
In your neighborhood, are there sidewalks or walking paths?
In your neighborhood, is there a park or playground?
In your neighborhood, is there a community center or recreation center where families get together?
In your neighborhood, is there a library or other place to get free books?
In your neighborhood, is there litter or garbage on the street or sidewalk?
In your neighborhood is there poorly kept or rundown housing?
In your neighborhood, is there vandalism such as broken windows or graffiti?
To what extent do you agree with these statements about your neighborhood or community?
People in your neighborhood help each other out.
People in your neighborhood watch out for each other's children.
Your child is safe in your neighborhood.
When you encounter difficulties, you know where to go for help in your community.
Your child is safe at school.

These are statements people have made about their food situation. For these statements, please mark whether the statement was often true, sometimes true, or never true for your household in the last 12 months.
The food that we bought just didn't last, and we didn't have enough money to get more.
We couldn't afford to eat balanced meals.
In the last 12 months, did you or other adults in your household ever cut the size of your meals or skip meals because there wasn't enough money for food?
If yes, how often did this happen - almost every month, some months but not every month, or in only 1 or 2 months?
Some months but not every month
Below are statements about the environment in your home. Please indicate how much you agree that the statement is true of your home.
We are usually able to stay on top of things.
You can't hear yourself think in our home.
The atmosphere in our home is calm.
We have a regular morning routine at home.
How well do you think you are handling the day-to-day demands of raising children?
Over the last two weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?
More than half of the days
Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying
Little interest or pleasure in doing things
We are interested in how you feel about the following statements. Read each statement carefully. Indicate how you feel about each statement.
There is a special person (ex: spouse, partner, etc.) who is around when I am in need.
There is a special person (ex: spouse, partner, etc.) with whom I can share joys and sorrows.
My family really tries to help me.
I get the emotional help & support I need from my family.
I have a special person (ex: spouse, partner, etc.) who is a real source of comfort to me.
My friends really try to help me.
I can count on my friends when things go wrong.
I can talk about my problems with my family.
I have friends with whom I can share my joys and sorrows.
There is a special person (ex: spouse, partner, etc.) in my life who cares about my feelings.
My family is willing to help me make decisions.
I can talk about my problems with my friends.
In your day-to-day life how often have any of the following things happened to you?
You are treated with less courtesy or respect than other people.
You receive poorer service than other people at restaurants or stores.
People act as if they think you are not smart.
People act as if they are afraid of you.
Please select Yes or No to indicate whether each event has happened to you in the past year.
An injury or illness which kept you in bed a week or more, or sent you to the hospital.
An injury or illness which was less serious than above but still sent you to the doctor or kept you in bed for a day or two.
Major change in your usual type and/or amount of recreation.
Change to a new type of work.
Change in your work hours or conditions.
Change in your responsibilities at work (more responsibilities).
Change in your responsibilities at work (fewer responsibilities).
Change in your responsibilities at work (promotion).
Change in your responsibilities at work (demotion).
Change in your responsibilities at work (transfer).
Troubles at work (with persons under your supervision).
Loss of a job (laid off from work).
Loss of a job (fired from work).
Taking a course to help you with your work.
Change in residence (move within the same town or city).
Change in residence (move to a different town, city, or state).
Major change in health or behavior of family member.
Gain of a new family member (birth of a child).
Gain of a new family member (adoption of a child).
Gain of a new family member (a relative moving in with you).
Change to the marital status of your parents (divorce).
Change to the marital status of your parents (remarriage).
Separation from spouse (due to marital problems).
Death of other family member (brother or sister).
Beginning or ending school or college.
"Falling out" of a close personal relationship.
Major decision regarding your immediate future.
Major change in finances (investment and/or credit difficulties).
Loss or damage of personal property.
Foreclosure on a mortgage or loan.

Instructions: Think of this line as representing where people stand in the country where you live. To the right are the people who are the best off - those who have the most money, the most education, and the most respected jobs. To the left are the people who are the worst off - those who have the least money, the least education, the least respected jobs, or no job. The further to the right you are on the line, the closer you are to the people at the very top; the further to the left you are, the closer you are to the people at the very bottom.
Where would you place yourself on this line?
Move the slider to where you think you stand at this time in your life relative to other people in your country.

Instructions: Think of this line as representing where people stand in their communities. People define community in different ways; please define it in whatever way is most meaningful to you. To the right are people who have the highest standing in their community. To the left are the people who have the lowest standing in their community.
Where would you place yourself on this line?
Move the slider to where you think you stand at this time in your life relative to other people in your community.
